titleStmt.title: To the right-Right Honourable, HONORIA, Wife of IAMES, Lord HAY, Sole Daughter and Heire of EDVVARD Lord DENNY.
titleStmt.author: Sylvester, Josuah

publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

analytic.title: To the right-Right Honourable, HONORIA, Wife of IAMES, Lord HAY, Sole Daughter and Heire of EDVVARD Lord DENNY.
analytic.author: Sylvester, Josuah

monogr.title: All the small vvorkes of that famous poet Iosuah Siluester : Gathered into one volume
monogr.author: Sylvester, Josuah

div.head: To the right-Right Honourable, HONORIA, Wife of IAMES, Lord HAY, Sole Daughter and Heire of EDVVARD Lord DENNY.
div.l: To Two deer Equals (to You equall Deer);
Vnable (yet) with Both at once to cleer,
Vnwilling yet, with Eyther to be rude:
• aine would I craue to haue my Bond renewd,
For a more Happy, or more Hopefull Year,
When gratious Heav'n shall daign to set me freer
From old cold Cares, which keep my Muse vnmew'd.
Would You be pleas'd (Madame) to interpose
Your gentle breath, I would not doubt to speed:
Such vertue hath Your Vertue stil with Those.
Therefore in Hope of Your kinde Help (at need)
This simple Pledge I Offer at Your Feet;
Altar of Loue, Where both Their Vowes doe meet.

closer.signed: Yor. Honorable Vertue's humble Votarie, Iosuah Syluester.
